result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Roscoe Ballinger

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Robert Roscoe Ballinger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared by video for Robert Roscoe Ballinger.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
